title: On Mahatma Gandhi's 150th Birth Anniversary, PM Narendra Modi Launches Rs 150 Coins
text:
On Mahatma Gandhi’s 150th birth anniversary, Prime Minister Narendra Modi released commemorative stamps and Rs 150 coins in Ahmedabad.

"The whole world is celebrating Bapu's birth anniversary. A few days ago, the United Nations (UN) released a postal stamp to make this occasion memorable, now commemorative stamps and coins have also been released here," said Prime Minister Narendra Modi at 'Swachh Bharat Diwas' event.

ANI

On this Swachh Bharat Diwas, Modi also declared India to be an open-defecation free. ‘I am satisfied that on the occasion of Gandhi at 150, we are witnessing the fulfillment of his dream of 'Swachh Bharat'. I feel lucky that on this occasion, when India has successfully stopped open defecation, I'm here at the ashram,’ read the Prime Minister's message in the visitor's book at Sabarmati Ashram here.

"Today the whole world is appreciating and awarding us. Providing toilets to more than 60 crore people in 60 months, building more than 11 crore toilets, the whole world is amazed by this," he said.

"Today rural India and its villages have declared themselves open defecation free," he said. He also said that India will eradicate the ‘single-use plastic’ by the year 2022. "Sanitation, conservation of environment and animals, all these things were dear to Gandhi Ji. Plastic is a major threat to all of them. So, we have to achieve the goal to eradicate 'single-use plastic' from the country by the year 2022," said PM Modi.
